captions.text:
[Magnus Magnusson]
I'd like to start, if I may, with Professor Hawking
How did the Universe start? With a 'Big Bang'?

[Stephen Hawking]
We observe that distant galaxies are moving away from us
They must have been closer together in the past
It was the beginning of the Universe, and of time itself
Anything that happened before the Big Bang
Could not affect what happened after

[Richard Dawkins]
The poetry of the expanding Universe
The poetry of the complexity of life
We're not normally equipped to understand
But science gives it to us
Science is opening your eyes
To the wonderfulness of what's there
Science is opening your eyes
To the poetry of the expanding Universe

[Magnusson]
We come to you, Carl Sagan
Could you help me by putting in layman's terms
What was involved with this 'Big Bang'?

[Carl Sagan]
The early Cosmos was everywhere white hot
But then as time passed
The radiation expanded and cooled
Then, little pockets of gas began to grow
Steadily brightening... we call them the 'galaxies'

[Hawking]
It was the beginning of the Universe, and of time itself
Anything that happened before the Big Bang,
Could not affect what happened after

[Dawkins]
The poetry of the expanding Universe
The poetry of the complexity of life
We're not normally equipped to understand
But science gives it to us

[Tara Shears]
In the Big Bang we had equal amounts of matter and antimatter
And as soon as these met each other
They annihilated together
And this battle played out, whilst the Universe expanded
In its first minute of existence
And this battle played out, whilst the Universe expanded
In its first minute of existence

[Neil DeGrasse Tyson]
It's not all that hard to detect the Big Bang
All you need to do is change the channel
Until you come between two stations
About one percent of the snow and noise
Comes from the Big Bang itself
We are all eavesdroppers on the birth pangs of the Cosmos

[Hawking]
It was the beginning of the Universe, and of time itself

[Shears]
And this battle played out

[Dawkins]
Science is opening your eyes
To the poetry of the expanding Universe

[Shears]
And this battle played out, whilst the Universe expanded
In its first minute of existence

[Hawking]
It was the beginning of the Universe, and of time itself
Subtitles by Charles Lapointe (Mithadon)
Go to www.symphonyofscience.com for more!

title: Symphony of Science - 'The Big Beginning' (ft. Hawking, Sagan, Dawkins, Shears, Tyson)

comments.author: kelly wilson whitehead

comments.text:
+Pk4En9 Time and Space were created only after the Big Bang. Time means 
cause and effect. For example, I go to someone's house, then I reach there. 
That's time. However, since there was no time before the Big Bang, there 
was no consequence, no cause, and since there was no space, essentially 
nothing happened. So, whatever happened before the Big Bang doesn't matter.

comments.text:
+Ashwin Gokhale

Dawkins is a very, very good writer.  He has a gift for breaking down 
complex ideas for the scientific lay person and making them more 
accessible.  And he does it with a lot of humor and knowledge.  Some of his 
writing is just laugh out loud funny.  He also has a wide frame of 
reference, incluidng a lot of good literature.

So, no. He's not perfect and he has his biases and prejudices but he's very 
good at educating people about science.

comments.text:
I am your friend.  I understand 100% the whole time we have been debating, 
the measure of what you have been saying.  BUT...I too have no answer.  I 
wish I had more to say to help us both, but I do not.
comments.author: Prometheus1st

comments.text:
+Prometheus1st From nothing stems everything...

0 is the sum of all numbers. Amazing, right? 0 isn't quite nothing. But 
there's no way to determine that we didn't come from 0. If we did come from 
0, then what process resulted in the universe adding 1, or something like 
that? What if there was a previous universe, that was approaching this "0"?

I have no idea. But I know that from zero, everything comes. But no one 
really knows how the universe began, not for sure. The Big Bang Theory is 
exactly that. It's a hypothesis that has proof. But what proof besides 
everything is moving away? Well there's the background radiation... It's 
still pretty warm. But they can be written off as caused by other things. 
So, what proof is there that the Universe began at a point? Definitive 
proof, proof that can't be denied no matter what. I've no idea. Others 
might, though.
comments.author: KASASpace

comments.text:
The universe according to your explanation was created from 'nothing' 
then?  I am saying that I agree with you on all counts but I also posit 
that the universe we live in today was NOT created from 'nothing'...just as 
we ourselves weren't.  THEREFORE...a beginning exists.  (Began/Created)  
Time is often referred to as an 'arrow'.  That said every arrow that flies 
forward has been loosed at a given moment.  No arrow in flight has an 
indefinable point of origin (Beginning) or an indefinable target (Ending).  
Time...as indefinable as it may seem to be has rules which bend it also to 
the will of the universe.  The universe BEGAN, so did time...it and we are 
prisoners to that fact.
comments.author: Prometheus1st

comments.text:
+Prometheus1st Not the case. I was conceived on a day, about nine months 
before my birthday. The atoms that made up my body at that time were 
created when time began. I am made up of different atoms now. You wouldn't 
say that I was created a second time, would you?
comments.author: KASASpace

comments.text:
Perception has a say in our reality or the celebrated "Schrodinger's Cat" 
thought experiment must be 100% wrong and THAT would throw many things 
currently accepted as solid thought in Physics on their ears.
comments.author: Prometheus1st

comments.text:
You seem to draw some sort of line/distinction between the two terms 
"Created" and "Began"  So then, let me ask - When were you born?  "Created" 
is equally interchangeable  with the question:  "When did your life 
BEGIN?"  Seriously...you cannot answer either question truthfully/factually 
without the answer being one and the same.  So, there is no difference.
comments.author: Prometheus1st

comments.text:
+Prometheus1st Time is the reference frame for a "beginning" in all cases. 
What reference frame was there for time to begin?
comments.author: KASASpace

comments.text:
+KASASpace
"Time can't begin"?  Everything I know about the physical world refutes 
that.  Causality refutes that.  To say that TIME cannot have a beginning is 
to say that causality doesn't exist.

The two are both the chicken AND the egg.
comments.author: Prometheus1st

comments.text:
+The Anti-Theist A beginning is in a reference frame. before the BB, there 
wasn't any reference frame. thus, Time did not begin. Nothing began. It had 
to have been there... Unless there's something we don't know about.

Anyhow, I'm more of an applying science guy, not the actual making of the 
science.

comments.text:
+The Anti-Theist The point here is that it's a stupid statement to say that 
time began. "Began" is relative to something else in time. Saying it was 
created is a different story almost entirely.
comments.author: KASASpace

comments.text:
It's easy to understand if you well, - understand it...
There is two types of time, go study Hawking for the definitions. 

Why do people feel the need to ask these types of questions with no 
knowledge themselves? 

Time was created at The Big Bang, as was everything else. space-time, 
matter, even time. You ought to also read A Universe from Nothing by 
Lawrence Krauss. 

You also must already have a rather low understanding for science, since 
you should know by now most things are counter-intuitive, we did not evolve 
to understand quantum machines. Our common sense is meaningless in the face 
of physics and the universe.
comments.author: The Anti-Theist

comments.text: Read the book "A universe from Nothing" by Lawrence Krauss.

The seed of the universe.

You're searching about the "code" ? Well, your question is irrelevant :
The theory of "symetry" (the actual and the most advanced one) states that 
before big bang, the universe was pure matter and anti-matter.
So it was pure energy, with no matter. Then, something happenned (what ? we 
don't know) and caused an disorder of the matter/anti-matter ratio. And so, 
matter was created. This may have produced a chain reaction resluting to a 
single Core Hyper-Heavy and Hyper powerful. And that Core exploded. This is 
the Big bang.
*_*
And this disorder that created matter refutes your question : there is no 
code, as it started with an "incident".
Goodbye gentlemen.

comments.text:
+Thrice L. Alford ad hominem and straw man? I get a double attack! 

I never claimed that we came from nothing. I do not know how the universal 
got its start. Only evidence we have is an expanding universal/ Big Bang. 
You, my friend, claim a deity created this universal. Out of what, what was 
before the big bang? Nothing? Following your logic, something created the 
universal -> what created that thing to create the universe? THEN, what 
created that thing that created that thing that create the universe? You 
see how troubling it is to claim a deity create the universal? It is 
turtles all the way down. 

If you claim this deity is eternal, could not I save a step and claim the 
universe eternal. There would be no use for a deity. If you claim this 
question answerable, could we not save a step and claim the origin of the 
universe unanswerable.   

*DOUBLE COMBO AGREEMENT FROM LeMatt Saphirium!!!
comments.author: CiceroTheSage

The God hypothesis is built on the evidence on the bible and solely on the

believed in and actions taken in its name. It all comes down to logic, 
based on scientific hypothesis testing.

explains why things occur or happen.
